title: Hansheinz Schneeberger, violinist who gave the premiere of Bartok’s First Violin Concerto half a century after its composition – obituary
text:
Hansheinz Schneeberger, who has died aged 93, was a Swiss violinist who in 1958 gave the belated premiere of Bela Bartok’s First Violin Concerto; the work had been written in 1907-08 for Stefi Geyer, a Hungarian violinist with whom the 26-year-old Bartok was madly in love.

It includes a four-note theme over which Bartok had written to her “this is your Leitmotiv”, but she rejected both him and the concerto, and for many years it was thought to have been lost.

Bartok died in 1945, and when Geyer died in 1956, never having played the concerto, she bequeathed the manuscript to Paul Sacher, the Swiss conductor and impresario, with the instruction that he perform it with Schneeberger.

That concert...
